intro: Hieracium cavillieri subsp. soyerifolium, commonly known as the soyerifolium hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellowish to orange-red composite flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered with fine hairs, and it produces small, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. This subspecies is distinguished by its unique leaf morphology and habitat preferences.
